org.dyn4j.collision

Class AxisAlignedBounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dyn4j.collision.AbstractBounds
      • org.dyn4j.collision.AxisAlignedBounds
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bounds, Transformable

    public class AxisAlignedBounds
extends AbstractBounds
implements Bounds, Transformable
    Represents a bounding region that is an Axis-Aligned bounding box.

    This class compares its AABB with the AABB of the given body and returns true if they do not overlap.

    Since this class is Axis-Aligned the rotate(double), rotate(double, Vector2), and rotate(double, double, double) methods are no-ops.

    The AbstractBounds.getTransform() method returns the transform used by the current instance. Calling the rotate methods on the returned transform will cause undefined behavior.

    Since:
    3.1.1
    Version:
    3.1.1
    Author:
    William Bittle

      • isOutside

        public boolean isOutside(Collidable collidable)
        Description copied from interface: Bounds
        Returns true if the given Collidable is outside the bounds.

        If the Collidable contains zero BodyFixtures then Collidable is considered to be outside the bounds.

        Specified by:
        isOutside in interface Bounds
        Parameters:
        collidable - the Collidable to test
        Returns:
        boolean true if outside the bounds
